intro: Obione schugnanica, commonly known as the Schugnanica orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, intricate flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant prefers cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces fragrant, tubular flowers in shades of white and pale yellow. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Obione schugnanica is considered a species of conservation concern.
